lines.text: [Pochenko gestures to hit Katrina]
What are you doing?
You do not understand
Oh no? You have the temper of an eight year old, your own children are scared to DEATH of you! And you hit girls! Tell me when I'm getting warm!
This whole thing is none of your business!

You know maybe you're right. Because even if you can't see that doing the right thing even when you have nothing to gain, is what makes you... a mench, and decent, and civilized! I can't have anything to do with you
They boy will remain in prison, it's none of your business
You know everyone is right about you... you are a beast...
Put on your sunblock because it's rays today, raisins tomorrow.
In our country we can marry who we want. I decided on John Kennedy Jr., and while he's in denial, I'll travel.
Oh honey, talk to the hand, the ears ain't listening!
Do I not intimidate you at all?
Is one of your sideburns longer than the other?
I know where we are.
Well, where are we?
We're in the woods.
I knew it. Why can't you just ask one of them for directions?
NO!
Please! Asking for directions is not the first step to a two-party system.

[Outside Joy's parents house]
Before you throw me out, I have three things to say. One; I released the boy from prison. Two; I'm holding free elections in the Spring. Three... Well I can't think of something else.
One and two are plenty!
[They kiss]
Come on, we can make our own sandwich.
I don't know where anything is in this kitchen.
Oh come on, I can find food at Ghandi's house. What're you kidding me?
You should try running a country for a day. It's not all making war and smashing dissidents, you know. It's hard work.
I'm sure it is.
Where is some...
What?
Mayonnaise?
We finished it.
Oh.
[gives her a look]
Hmmm?
You're lying.
It's all gone.
Where is it?
I had to scrape for this.
Give it me!
Oh all right, I'll give it you, give it you. Here you go.
Hah. Hah-hah, heh-heh-heh, heh, heh, heh, heh.
I just hope you realize you're entering those dangerous heart attack years.
[Motto for her cosmetology class]
Flashy, not trashy.
In Slovetzia, hard work today, happiness tomorrow.
Oh, you Americans and your positive thinking. There are some situations that a big toothed person cannot get you out of.
[Trying to talk Pochenko into shaving]
OK, a lot of great men had mustaches. Hitler, Franco...
Einstein!
Oh, and that's who you wanna look like?
It's control-top pantyhose. Holds you in like a stuffed sausage.
I thought you teach science!
TEACH it? I didn't even PASS it!
Could I possibly get a blanket without a head?
Who are you and what did you do with the little Nazi kid?
I don't know where anything is in this kitchen
Oh come on, I can find food in Ghandi's house, are you kidding me?
Oh my, call an ambulance! She doesn't know what to say!
It's like Paris 50 years ago.
There were Nazis in Paris 50 years ago.
What a nice man that hermit was. I didn't even know I had a hermit!

[talking to Svetlana]
Hello how are you?
[silence]
I killed a cow right over there.
[more silence]
It was very nice meeting you!
You don't look like the other teacher. She was ugly with missing teeth and her breath smelled like something died, farting in her mouth.
Now, about this business at the factory...
Oh you know what there's no need to apologize, I know that you were cranky 'cause you didn't have your lunch. You could be hyperglycemic, you should carry a piece of cheese with you.
This is a special place. Was it special for someone else too?
It's where I slaughtered my first cow.
Huh?
I was ten. My father told me I could eat only what I killed myself. All I had was two sticks and a butter knife, but I learned to be a man that day.
Oh, what a sweet story.
Why must you always go one step too far? You could be such a pleasant person if you just had a tiny little edit button.
